alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Blount; Grainger; Jefferson; Knox; Loudon; Morgan; Roane; Sevier; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 1:02PM CDT until August 07 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Morgan County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Loudon County in east Tennessee... Knox County in east Tennessee... Anderson County in east Tennessee... Northern Blount County in east Tennessee... West central Jefferson County in east Tennessee... Southwestern Grainger County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Roane County in east Tennessee... South central Union County in east Tennessee... Northwestern Sevier County in east Tennessee... * Until 300 PM EDT. * At 202 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Farragut, or near Oak Ridge, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Maryville, Sevierville, Clinton, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Kingston, Farragut and Oliver Springs. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 359 and 409. Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 77 and 127. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for east Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Blount; Grainger; Jefferson; Knox; Loudon; Morgan; Roane; Sevier; Union
